Class GuitarFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • GuitarFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GuitarFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
    Creates the GUI where a user can use the guitar simulator
    See Also:

      • setString

        public static int setString(double x,
            double y)
        Gets the string number of the guitar based on x and y coordinates
        Parameters:
        x - the x position
        y - the y position
        Returns:
        the string number with 1 being the top string and 6 being the bottom string
